The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in West Sussex so far as at 24 April is 41,788 (4,836.7 cases per 100,000 population). In the seven days to 19 April, there were 136 new confirmed cases (15.7 new cases per 100,000). In the seven days to 12 April, there were 157 new cases, and so the new cases have decreased by 13% (21 fewer cases).
